content:
For info:
Today's master won't build on VS2022 due to "#include <sqlite3.h> could not be found"
I changed in CMakeLists.txt as of below, i.e. back 9522e004, and it builds again.
But don't ask me why?

@@ -1264,8 +1264,11 @@ if (OCPN_USE_CRASHREPORT)
     message(STATUS "Using Linux crash reporting")
   endif ()
 endif ()

+add_subdirectory("libs/sqlite")
+target_link_libraries(${PACKAGE_NAME} PRIVATE ocpn::sqlite)
+
 add_subdirectory("libs/SQLiteCpp")
 target_link_libraries(${PACKAGE_NAME} PRIVATE ocpn::sqlite_cpp)

 add_subdirectory("libs/shapelib")
@@ -1953,9 +1956,9 @@ add_subdirectory(libs/observable)
 add_subdirectory(libs/picosha2)
 add_subdirectory(libs/pugixml)
 add_subdirectory(libs/rapidjson)
 add_subdirectory(libs/s52plib)
-add_subdirectory(libs/sqlite)
+#add_subdirectory(libs/sqlite)

Run Cmake on Windows. I get a number of error like below Patchfile message.
I don't think it disturb any further build and the make and runtime is fine. So this is just a Q if anyone know about the reason for these errors?

-- Using Windows CrashRpt
-- Could NOT find Shapelib (missing: SHAPELIB_LIBRARY SHAPELIB_INCLUDE_DIR)
-- Using downloaded shapelib at C:/Builds/OCPN/OpenCPN/build/_deps/shapelib_src-src
-- Applying patch 0001-cmake-Add-guard-for-multiple-inclusions.patch
CMake Error at C:/Builds/OCPN/OpenCPN/libs/shapelib/cmake/PatchFile.cmake:29 (message):
  Failed to apply
  C:/Builds/OCPN/OpenCPN/libs/shapelib/patches/0001-cmake-Add-guard-for-multiple-inclusions.patch
  in C:/Builds/OCPN/OpenCPN/build/_deps/shapelib_src-src using C:/Program
  Files/Git/usr/bin/patch.exe
It just means the patch has already been applied or isn’t needed anymore.
